intro: Homalobus dispar, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a rosette of leaves with a central stem bearing clusters of flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires indirect light to flourish. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
